dialogue_lines: There she is. Miss 'I’ll be outside in 2 minutes' — it’s been ten.
Okay but like, I was being productive. I was panicking and rewriting my intro slide.
Productive panic. My favorite academic genre.
Be real — how much of your part did you actually finish?
(They turn onto the main road toward uni. Streetlights flicker on. The glow of Srekja is just a few blocks away.)
Okay, so we’re walking in, pretending we’re calm, and then forcing everyone to stay focused for at least one hour.
...Fine. Thirty minutes and one coffee refill. Let’s go.
You know Tina’s gonna derail the whole thing with some ‘what if we add this last-minute’ idea.
Oh absolutely. And Anja’s gonna be calm about it while silently fixing all our slides.
Marta’s probably already rewriting the conclusion again...
Which I will pretend to love because I am a supportive teammate.
choice_sets: Joke about just winging the whole thing
Ask Sanja if she brought snacks
Vent about staying up late fixing the dialog code
response_dialogue: Honestly? If we wing it with enough confidence, they'll think it's a creative choice.
Spoken like someone who’s done that before.
Please tell me you brought snacks.
Girl… I literally brought dark chocolate and espresso shots.
That’s the most chaotic combo and I respect it.
I stayed up until 3am just fixing the dialog code.
Wait, you were still coding last night?
Marta added something and crashed the whole thing so I was helping her.
At this point I’m just emotionally attached to debugging it.
